== Weblinks ==
Test both plain and marked-up links.
=== With punctuation ===
`(text URL)` or `URL,` or `URL?`
# (http://www.abc.com/koko#lili) TODO: (low priority) unsupported syntax: not highlighted, no html
# https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Smith_(mathematician)
# `https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Smith_(mathematician)`
# (this link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Smith_(mathematician))
# http://http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)  hmm
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor),
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor);
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor):
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor).
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)!
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)?
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)_again?
# (http://www.novell.com/linux/releasenotes/x86_64/SUSE-SLES/11/#rnotes-deprecated) TODO: (low priority) not a valid link...
# www.example.com/koko#lili not enough!
# http://www.abc.com/koko#lili(here space is really needed!)
# hjklhttp://www.abc.com/koko#lili   ? accepted? TODO: (high priority) I think, whitespace or a punctuation mark should be at the beginning of a weblink.

=== Several on a line ===
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor), http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor); http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)?
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim,     http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim;    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim.     http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim?     http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim!
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim; http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim!
# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim; http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim? something

=== Examples of URIs ===
{{{
     http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4248
     ftp://ftp.is.co.za/rfc/rfc1808.txt
     http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt
     mailto:John.Doe@example.com
     news:comp.infosystems.www.servers.unix
     tel:+1-816-555-1212
     doi:10.1000/182
     telnet://192.0.2.16:80/
     git://github.com/gitster/git.git
     urn:oasis:names:specification:docbook:dtd:xml:4.1.2
     ldap://[2001:db8::7]/c=GB?objectClass?one
}}}

== Bracketed Weblinks ==
`[URL DESCRIPTION]` or `[URL ]`?
{{{
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor) Vim]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor) (Vim)]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor) http://what?]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor) ]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim  ]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim  ][doi:10.1000/182 This Document]
# [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor) http://what?] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim  ][doi:10.1000/182 This Document]
# [doi:10.1000/182 This Document]
# [telnet://192.0.2.16:80/  local server]
# [git://github.com/gitster/git.git  Gitster]
# [urn:oasis:names:specification:docbook:dtd:xml:4.1.2  abstract]
# [ldap://[2001:db8::7]/c=GB?objectClass?one      _Fixed now!_]
}}}

== Markdown Weblinks ==
`[DESCRIPTION](URL)`
{{{
# http://code.google.com/p/vimwiki/wiki/NormalizeLinkSyntax
# [github.com](http://github.com)
# [github.com](http://github.com)(what to do here?)
# (and this link [github.com](http://github.com))
# [and other links like [github.com](http://github.com)] what to do here?
# [Vim (text_editor)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor))
# (and this link [Vim (text_editor)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)))
}}}
# http://code.google.com/p/vimwiki/wiki/NormalizeLinkSyntax
# [github.com](http://github.com)
# [github.com](http://github.com)(what to do here?)
# (and this link [github.com](http://github.com))
# [and other links like [github.com](http://github.com)] what to do here?
# [Vim (text_editor)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor))
# (and this link [Vim (text_editor)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)))
